feels alright tapes presents:

worlds greatest dad: 
"Worlds greatest dad is anything but great" – Future Pitchfork Review Formed in 2014 during a manic phase as an attempt to cope, worlds greatest dad shows and tells you how it feels to have major depressive disorder. Maddie Duncan (Vocals/Guitar) gets deep in her head and takes you along on her emotional self-discovery and exploration of personal feelings. Through what can be described as emotive indie rock, Duncan uses her lyrics to walk you through her self-diagnosis, relentless efforts to cope, and eventual repetition of the clinical cycle. Their upbeat songs radiate fake happiness as a mask for the persistent feeling of sadness or loss of interest that characterizes what is actually being said. The band’s upcoming full-length features danceable pop rock radio hits - if the radio was playing in the waiting room of a psychiatrist’s office. 
worldsgreatestdadmusic.bandcamp.com

event: Premium Sound One Year Birthday Bash
desc:
It's time to celebrate y'all! August marks 1 year that I've been lugging crates around town to sling the wax to the fine people of Charlotte. So now we party! 

Tyler (DJ Omelette Baum or the world famous Charlotte Omelette) will be providing the tunes on the turntables as well as Rob Davis, Scott Slagle, Bo White and Zach Reader will all he bringing THE FUNK of both American and Latin varieties. Best be prepared to dance y'all! Even better... Ghost Trees (https://ghost-trees.bandcamp.com) will be  setting the room ablaze with the Deep South free jazz fire we've grown accustomed to searing our senses...

Needles & Pins (Custom jewelery by Blaine Hurdle):  http://tinyurl.com/rn6cj45 will be showing and selling some of the most original, inspired jewelry pieces you will come across in the world...

Speaking of inspired, Top Rope Tacos are bringing some of the best carnitas I've ever tasted in addition to vegan ground "beef" among other options and holy crap, you better have some of their guacatillo! Yep I said GUACATILLO.  

And it wouldn't be a vinyl pop-up without my dude's from DIGGER'S DELIGHT (Facebook.com/diggersdelightvinyl) bringing their finely curated crates as well! 

Let's party. 

$5 drink combo! House shot and a 12oz PBR

8pm doors || 8:30 music || Free Admission
